section.title: The Girl DespairsLoses Hope
section.p: The girl sat on a small stool in the middle of the room, looking at the straw all around her. She knew that she could never spin any of that straw into gold. Not in one night, or her entire lifetime. She began to weep cry, certain that she and her father would be executed punished that morning.

While the girl was crying, she heard a quiet chuckle in the room with her. She looked up to see a little man atop the straw. He was no taller than a child, with a sly mischievous grin and bright eyes. He understood the girl’s plightproblem and offered his help for a price. If the girl would give him her bracelet of beads, then he would spin the straw into gold for her.

section.title: Straw Into Gold
section.p: The miller’s daughter did not trust this strange little man, but she had no other options. She agreed to the exchange, and gave him her beads. He immediately began to spin the straw. Spool after spool came off the wheel, heavy with golden threads. When the king opened the door in the morning, the little man was gone and the room was full of gold.
